head.supplied: Thursday ¶ ¶ I had the pleasure, dear Chev. ¶ Archer, to propose you through Mr Bentham (the President) & Mr Kippist (the Librarian) a FLS by the outgoing mail, and enclosed your note to Mr Kippist ...

div.p: 2/137/6, Archer papers, University of Melbourne Archives, Melbourne.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 0.3335in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3335in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: M proposed Archer for the Linnean Society of London in his letter to Bentham of 21 March 1874, this date being a Saturday. Hence the present letter was almost certainly written on Thursday 26 March 1871.

div.p:
I had the pleasure, dear Chev.
i.e. Chevalier. This presumably refers to the papal decoration of Gregory the Great bestowed on Archer in 1870. Archer, to propose you through Mr Bentham (the President) & Mr Kippist (the Librarian) a FLS by the outgoing mail, and enclosed your note to Mr Kippist
Letter to Kippist not found. concerning the Bank-arrangements

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Ferd von Mueller
Archer was elected a Fellow of the Linnean Society on 5 November 1874 on the nomination of M, Bentham and Joseph Hooker.
